oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vol. 2, Issue 3 September 1955
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Southern School News, Volume 2, No 3 September 1955. Taken from the paper, Southern School News

Southern School News is the official publication of the Southern Education Reporting Service, an objective, fact-finding agency established by southern newspaper editors and educators with the aim of providing accurate, unbiased information to school administrators, public officials and interested lay citizens on developments in education arising from the U.S. Supreme Court opinion of May 17, 1954 declaring segregation in the schools unconstitutional.

Southern School News is the official publication of the Southern Education Reporting Service, an objective, fact-finding agency established by southern newspaper editors and educators with the aim of providing accurate, unbiased information to school administrators, public officials and interested lay citizens on developments in education arising from the U.S. Supreme Court opinion of May 17, 1954 declaring segregation in the schools unconstitutional.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vol. 10, Issue 4 October 1963
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Southern School News, Volume 10, No 4 October 1963. Taken from the paper, Southern School News

Southern School News is the official publication of the Southern Education Reporting Service, an objective, fact-finding agency established by southern newspaper editors and educators with the aim of providing accurate, unbiased information to school administrators, public officials and interested lay citizens on developments in education arising from the U.S. Supreme Court opinion of May 17, 1954 declaring segregation in the schools unconstitutional.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vol. 10, Index
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Southern School News, Volume 10, Index. Taken from the paper, Southern School News

Southern School News is the official publication of the Southern Education Reporting Service, an objective, fact-finding agency established by southern newspaper editors and educators with the aim of providing accurate, unbiased information to school administrators, public officials and interested lay citizens on developments in education arising from the U.S. Supreme Court opinion of May 17, 1954 declaring segregation in the schools unconstitutional.
